s1: Defensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of anomaly / intrusion detection and identification mechanisms.
s2: This is an advanced undergraduate course that covers advanced topics in Artificial Intelligence. Topics vary from one offering to the next and are likely to be drawn from the following list: planning, scheduling, games, search, reasoning (constraint-based, model-based, spatial, temporal), knowledge representation, decision-making under uncertainty, reinforcement learning, agents, foundations.

s1: Students will also learn and exercise handling of an existing intrusion which includes forensic operations as well as securing the remaining systems.
s2: Improve their skills at navigating through, and critically examining, the scientific literature on the taught topic(s).

s1: This is a complete course in cyber defense which enables students on successful completion to operate systems under real-world exposure.
s2: Gain both a wide and a deep knowledge of the topic(s) taught in the current instance of the course.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying the defence of systems and networks.
s2: Improve their skills at navigating through, and critically examining, the scientific literature on the taught topic(s).

s1: Define and identify defensive cyber security architectures and their purpose.
s2: This is an advanced undergraduate course that covers advanced topics in Artificial Intelligence. s1: Operate defensive network architectures and systems in a practical context.
s2: This is an advanced undergraduate course that covers advanced topics in Artificial Intelligence. s1: Extrapolate current threats and identify potential, future threats.
s2: Improve their skills at navigating through, and critically examining, the scientific literature on the taught topic(s).
